We are so pleased to announce another scholarship winner! One of this year's St HOPE HARLEM Scholarships goes to... Shelley!

Shelley attends The Beacon School. Her transition from the small, close-knit community at St HOPE to her large high school inspired her to want to listen and help others as much as she can. She has held several internships at the Brooklyn Public Library and spearheaded the first Bilingual Storytime. She also interned for the TeleStory program, which connects incarcerated individuals with their families through video visits at library branches, and she sits on the library's Teen Trustees Board. Shelley hopes to major in Political Science so that she can become a criminal lawyer, and this fall she will be attending Brandeis University. Way to go Shelley!!

As we look forward to welcoming new members to the St HOPE family, we're thrilled to share with you one of the amazing opportunities our scholars have access to! We're excited to announce which of our alumni has won the 2019-2020 St HOPE HARLEM Journey Scholarship: Tyler!

Tyler is a junior at Siena College. He is a Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship recipient who was studying abroad this semester in Lyon, France. His strong sense of focus and passion for learning have contributed to his success, along with his zeal for taking risks by stepping outside of his comfort zone. Tyler is a Philosophy major and a Political Science minor, and he plans to attend law school. He hopes to pursue a career either as a Public Defender, or in International Law. The Journey Scholarship will greatly assist Tyler as he applies to law school and enrolls in LSAT prep courses. Congratulations Tyler!
